image.altText: A man in a cap and glasses.

props.synopsis: The devastated family of a missing four-year-old boy has released a statement saying it is holding on to hope "he will be found and returned safely" as authorities and community members continue the search in mid-north South Australia.

title.children: 'Our hearts are aching': Missing boy's family releases statement as search continues

image.altText: Chantelle has long dark hair and is wearing a blue jumper as she holds a tabby cat

props.synopsis: Just 12 hours after he was adopted, eight-month-old kitten Pierre was found in his carrier in the middle of the road, drenched after an overnight storm. Rescuers are urging owners to de-sex their cats, to help prevent other animals from enduring a similar ordeal.

title.children: Kitten rescuers 'in absolute shock' as newly adopted kitten dumped

props.synopsis: Robert Hall was killed when he was struck by partially blind driver John Charles Robertson on the Horrocks Highway in 2018. His family feel their pleas for licence reforms have been ignored by the state government.

title.children: Grieving family's anger at lack of licence reform amidst government 'buck-passing'

image.altText: A woman with a serious expression stands in front of posters on a wall

props.synopsis: SA Police conducted more than 1,600 metal detector searches at Burnside Village at the weekend, but the state's Guardian for Children and Young People says officials need to "get the balance right" amid a crackdown on knife crime.

title.children: Youth guardian calls for balance amid SA knife crime crackdown

image.altText: Close up photo of a southern pygmy perch in a human hand.

props.synopsis: Information gleaned from tiny growth rings on "ear bones" of native pygmy perch could be the key to bringing them back from local extinction in the lower Murray.Â

title.children: Rings on 'ear stones' helping re-establish native pygmy fish

image.altText: A dolphin mid-air with water splashing under it

props.synopsis: The "completely preventable" death of a three-year-old dolphin in Adelaide's Port River has prompted new calls for mandatory propeller guards on boats entering the sanctuary.

title.children: 'A huge amount of sadness': Orphaned dolphin killed in Adelaide's Port River

image.altText: A woman with short, curly grey hair stands next to a box planter pouring water from a green watering can.

props.synopsis: Dead sea life washed ashore during SA's marine algal bloom has been diverted into commercial compost for farms and gardens, in what has been viewed as a small win amid the large-scale devastation.

title.children: Algal bloom sea casualties find new life in commercial compost

image.altText: Jesse Wardlaw shrugs and smiles as she celebrates a goal in an AFLW game.

props.synopsis: St Kilda outscores Port Adelaide 38-0 in the final quarter after trailing by 27 points at three-quarter-time, while Ally Anderson and Ebony Marinoff become the first players to feature in 100 AFLW games.

title.children: Saints pull off record comeback win as AFLW stars celebrate centuries

image.altText: A dark-coloured feral pig on some grass near a patch of mud.

props.synopsis: Dozens of pigs were released illegally over several attempts to establish populations for hunting, with a local landscape board warning of the danger a feral population could cause.

title.children: Feral pigs found in SA were imported illegally from NSW, testing shows

image.altText: An image of two men composited next to each other. They both wear suits. One has short dark hair, the other has grey.

props.synopsis: South Australia's algal bloom continues to cause political headaches for state and federal Labor. Perhaps that's why scientists are copping some of the flak now.

title.children: As algal bloom recriminations grow, politicians point to the scientists

image.altText: Two older men in suits shake hands.

props.synopsis: For all US President Donald Trump's boasts about ending wars and being a worthy candidate for a Nobel Peace Prize, he has failed to end the war in Gaza and build a sustainable future for both Israelis and Palestinians. At least for now.

title.children: Benjamin Netanyahu has outmanoeuvred yet another American president

image.altText: Jessica Walker takes a selfie of her and Jayden Selfe standing in a river.

props.synopsis: Pictured riding on a luxury boat and posing on the deck of a multi-million-dollar home with sweeping views of the Swan River, life appeared good for Jessica Ann Walker in 2022 â but just three years later she would be charged with murdering a man.

title.children: A look inside the Attadale murder investigation that shocked neighbours

image.altText: Workers riding wrecking balls smashing caravans

props.synopsis: A leaked council email that shows wrecking balls smashing caravans has angered caravan owners facing eviction from four council-run parks.

title.children: Email with smiling workers on wrecking balls outrages caravan evictees

image.altText: PNAU performing at the Amphitheatre at Splendour In The Grass 2018

props.synopsis: A Sydney woman subjected to an unlawful strip search at a music festival has been awarded $93,000 in damages, in a judgement that could see thousands of others also receive compensation.

title.children: Woman awarded $93,000 in damages after 'humiliating' festival strip search

image.altText: Police stand around on the banks of Moore River

props.synopsis: A man in his 30s dies after an incident on the banks of the Moore River in Guilderton, while four other swimmers are rescued by bystanders.

title.children: Man drowns in holiday town north of Perth, four swimmers rescued

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a brown shirt.

props.synopsis:
The Riyadh Comedy Festival stars A-list comedians like Peter Davidson, but despite its blockbuster acts, it has copped backlash for what one human rights organisation says is a "whitewashing" of a "brutal repression of free speech".

Â

title.children: Why stars are 'disgusted' at those performing at a Saudi comedy festival

image.altText: A headshot of Lorde wearing a white t shirt in a studio setting.

props.synopsis: When Charli xcx released a song about her on the era-defining album Brat, Lorde didn't expect it to drag her onto a path that would redefine her trajectory.

title.children: 'It still destroys me': How Lorde's collaboration with Charli xcx changed her course

image.altText: Rugby league player with long hair, beard, holds ball in two hands for photograph

props.synopsis: Brisbane Broncos' mid-year recruit Ben Talty has been dropped for this Sunday's NRL grand final, making way for the returning Pat Carrigan.Â

title.children: Broncos welcome back Origin star, Storm unchanged for NRL grand final

image.altText: Man walks into court holding jug of juice, smiling

props.synopsis: Tylere Baker-Pearce, 39, was hit with two additional counts of the alleged offence on Monday after being arrested by counterterrorism police outside the Brisbane Magistrates Court.

title.children: Man charged with performing Nazi salute at AFL semi-final granted bail

image.altText: A large black gate at the front of a house with police tape hanging from it.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the sudden deaths of a mother and daughter whose bodies were found at a property in Kenmore Hills in Brisbane.

title.children: Crime scene declared after mother and daughter found dead at Airbnb

image.altText: Two women embrace while one is crying.

props.synopsis: Indonesian rescuers are scrambling to locate 38 people feared trapped under rubble after an Islamic boarding school collapsed in the East Java town of Sidoarjo.

title.children: Rescuers scramble to find students after Indonesian school collapse

image.altText: Two workers stand next to a boring machine in a tunnel

props.synopsis: NSW Opposition Leader Mark Speakman says the Coalition will build new metros if elected, making it a key plank of the Liberal Party's election platform.

title.children: Coalition's Sydney metro election promise amid possible $2bn blowout

image.altText: A photo of a street poster of Ayatollah Khomeini.

props.synopsis: For 12 days in June, the world watched as Iran and Israel traded blows. What came next was a brutal purge of spies and traitors.

title.children: Iran was stunned by Israel's spy infiltration. Now it's exacting its revenge

image.altText: Donald Trump gestures with his hands wide open sitting at a desk with an executive order in front of him in the Oval Office.

props.synopsis: The multi-billion-dollar Australian film industry searches for details after the US president announced he would impose a 100 per cent tariff on movies made outside America.

title.children: Aussie filmmakers scramble for clarity on Trump's tariffs twist

image.altText: A smiling Kerry Stokes in headshot in a dark conference room

props.synopsis: Media magnate Kerry Stokes will stand down as chair of Seven West Media after the company announced plans to merge with Southern Cross Media.Â

title.children: Kerry Stokes to stand down as Seven West Media chair amid merger

image.altText: A man's hands hold a leatherbound book titled "Parish Roll of Honour".

props.synopsis: The historic ledger, which bears the names of Toowoomba locals who served in WWII, went missing a month ago, but now it is back in safe hands thanks to a string of unlikely coincidences.

title.children: Practical joke leads to recovery of irreplaceable book stolen from church

image.altText: A front-on close-up of a crocodile laying on a muddy river bank.

props.synopsis: Four men, including a pilot who survived a fatal chopper crash in 2022, are facing Commonwealth charges for allegedly stealing saltwater crocodile eggs from Kakadu National Park.

title.children: 'Complex' evidence linked to crocodile egg stealing charges

image.altText: Big red ship docked in water

props.synopsis: The new Bass Strait ferries have both been completed but new works are needed after an issue with the vessels' hull specifications was detected.

title.children: Completed Spirit of Tasmania vessels now need hulls modified

image.altText: Two images showing men in costumes.

props.synopsis: Kane Cornes labels Geelong's Mad Monday antics "disrespectful" and "embarrassing", after a slew of social media posts raises eyebrows across the AFL community, including one referencing his Seven colleague Caroline Wilson.

title.children: AFL community reacts to Cats' 'disrespectful' and 'embarrassing' Mad Monday

image.altText: A man looks at the YouTube website on a computer screen.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump sued parent company Alphabet and other social media companies after the platforms suspended his accounts in 2021.Â

title.children: YouTube to pay Trump $33.46m following Jan 6 Capitol riots ban

image.altText: A nighttime photo of train tracks, with a group of people huddled around a bright light.

props.synopsis: Transport authorities are warning of a recent spike in a dangerous social media craze after a teenager fell onto railways tracks while reportedly train surfing.

title.children: Teenage boy injured after falling from train in Sydney's south

image.altText: Comedian and writer Sashi Perera in London, smiling while posing on the street wearing a floral shirt.

props.synopsis: The more people I spoke to, the less frightened I felt of my future. I could shift my focus to what I can do because I don't have a kid, instead of what I was missing out on.Â

title.children: Talking to others without kids helped me find a future after IVF

image.altText: A five-year-old girl of South Asian background with pig tails pointing to a card held by a preschool educator.

props.synopsis: Despite the government wanting its Thriving Kids program for children with "mild to moderate" developmental delay and autism to start next year, the system is yet to be designed.

title.children: How will the NDIS alternative for some autistic kids work?

image.altText: An emergency sign at the front of the Caboolture Hospital.

props.synopsis: Queensland's premier has called for an independent investigation into the problem, affecting up to 9,000 patients at Caboolture Hospital dating back to April 2023.

title.children: Delay in scan results showing patient had advanced cancer triggers major review

image.altText: Bad Bunny wearing a straw hat and brown suit, one hand on hat.

props.synopsis: Grammy-award winning rapper and singer Bad Bunny receives mixed reactions to the news he will headline the 2026 Super Bowl half-time show.

title.children: Who is Bad Bunny and why are critics upset he's headlining the Super Bowl?
